headline: Tinubu had surgery, I visited him in London to show support –Fayemi
summarized_story:
Ekiti State Governor and Chairman of the Nigeria Governors’ Forum, Kayode Fayemi, has said that he visited All Progressives Congress National Leader, Bola Tinubu, in London recently to show support for the ailing politician.
According to the governor, Tinubu had surgery and he had visited the former Lagos State governor alongside his Ondo State counterpart, Rotimi Akeredolu, to show solidarity.
Fayemi also said his visit to Tinubu was not connected to the 2023 general elections.
At least over 30 politicians have visited Tinubu, in London, in the last two months.

headline: 2023 Presidency: Only God knows what the future holds for me, says Fayemi
summarized_story:
Ekiti State Governor and Chairman of the Nigeria Governors’ Forum, Kayode Fayemi, says only God knows what his political future holds in the 2023 general elections.
Fayemi’s presidential campaign posters had gone viral in August 2020 and had sparked public debate on various social media platforms regarding the possibility of his candidacy in the 2023 presidential election.
“What the future holds, God knows, but we will cross that bridge when we get there.
For now, my primary responsibility is Ekiti State.”The governor also predicted victory for his party, the All Progressives Congress, in 2023.
Fayemi was first Ekiti State governor from October 2010 to October 2014.

headline: Alleged nude photos: Court fixes Oct 21 for arraignment of Ohakim
summarized_story:
Ikedi OhakimThe Federal High Court, Abuja, has fixed Oct. 21 for arraignment of former Imo Governor, Mr Ikedi Ohakim, for allegedly threatening to release nude photos of an Abuja-based woman, Mrs Chinyere Amuchienwa.
Justice Taiwo Taiwo ordered the Attorney-General of the Federation (AGF) and Minister of Justice, to take over the prosecution of Ohakim from the Inspector-General of Police, at the resumed trial on Monday.
The police had filed criminal charges against Ohakim and Chinedu Okpareke over alleged threat to life and threat to release nude pictures of Amuchienwa.
Counsel to Ohakim, Mr Emeka Etiaba (SAN), however, opposed the request by the AGF to take over the matter and prayed the court to dismiss the application.
He subsequently adjourned the matter until Oct. 21 for arraignment of the former governor and beginning of trial.

headline: COVID-19: How rich countries prevent poor ones from accessing vaccine – Lai Mohammed

headline: PIA: Nigeria introduces 2% yearly increase on royalty
summarized_story:
By Adewale SanyaoluThe Nigerian Government has introduced a two per cent annual increase on price based royalty for crude oil and condensates in the controversial Petroleum Industry Act (PIA).
According to the PIA, additional price based royalty shall apply to crude oil and condensates, which crystallises only when crude oil prices exceeds $50 ($100 shall attract 5 per cent and above $150 shall attract 10 per cent).
The rates apply to the 2020 fiscal year and shall be increased by 2 per cent yearly as provided in the PIA.
The price-based royalty shall be credited to the Nigerian Sovereign Wealth Fund.
The PIA had retained production-based royalty rates but added price-based royalty rates.

headline: Fayemi: All Governors Have Resolved to Dump Open Grazing
summarized_story:
Olawale Ajimotokan in AbujaThe Chairman of Nigeria Governors’ Forum (NGF) and Governor of Ekiti State, Dr. Kayode Fayemi yesterday disclosed that all governors in the country have in principle agreed that open grazing was outdated and there was need to embrace modern livestock management approaches.
“Any time there is an altercation between any of my colleagues, it is something that I feel wholly uncomfortable about because it takes us away from the substance, in this case on open grazing.
On the one hand, we have all agreed at the level of the NGF that open grazing is outdated and we need to look for alternative modern livestock management approaches,” Fayemi said.
And that is why I said both sides are correct in the sense that Nasir El- Rufai of Kaduna State is talking about ranching as alternative way of stopping unrestrained open grazing and catering to the need of those who embark on open grazing approaches.

headline: Indorama: A’Court Affirms Ownership Of 2.5% Equity Shares By Ex-Workers
summarized_story:
The Court of Appeal has dismissed an appeal challenging the decision of the National Industrial Court, Port Harcourt, Rivers State, affirming the ownership of 2.5% equity shares of Indorama Eleme Petrochemicals Limited by ex-workers of the company.
The National Industrial Court had earlier dismissed an application seeking to set aside an Arbitral judgement awarded and enforced by the Federal High Court in respect of the ownership of the 2.5% equity shares through their Cooperative Society.
But the Industrial Court declined entertaining the application over lack of jurisdiction, stating that the Federal High Court that granted the order enforcing the arbitral award was a court of coordinate jurisdiction.
Dissatisfied with the judgment of the Industrial Court, the Appellants approached the Court of Appeal to set aside the judgement of the industrial court and also to uphold their argument.
But the Appeal Court on Friday, September 24, 2021, dismissed the appeal and affirmed the judgment of the Federal High Court in favour of the former staff of Indorama Eleme Petrochemicals Company Limited.

headline: Kaduna abduction: Ten more students of Bethel college regain freedom
summarized_story:
At least ten additional student abducted from Bethel Baptist College in Kaduna State have regained their freedom.
The Kaduna State government and Police authorities are yet to comment on this development as at the time of filling this report.
We recall that 121 students were abducted at Bethel Baptist College in Chikun local government area of the state, when gunmen invaded the school July 5 2021.
The latest development, brings the total number of recovered students to one hundred and ten .
The students’ release comes three days after Nigerian police in Abuja displayed three bandits related to the Bethel Baptist College attack.

headline: China’s Biggest Airshow to Highlight Military Prowess
